Information :

Spaghetti is a type of pasta that is long, thin, and cylindrical in shape. It is a popular staple food in Italian cuisine and is often served with a variety of sauces and toppings. To prepare spaghetti, the pasta is boiled in a pot of salted water until it is cooked to the desired texture, which is typically al dente, or firm to the bite. The cooked spaghetti is then drained and can be served immediately or mixed with a sauce. There are countless types of sauces that can be served with spaghetti, ranging from simple tomato sauce to more complex meat-based sauces, such as Bolognese. Other popular toppings include olive oil, garlic, and grated cheese. In addition to traditional Italian cuisine, spaghetti has become a popular ingredient in many other types of dishes, such as spaghetti carbonara, spaghetti and meatballs, and spaghetti with clam sauce. Spaghetti is a versatile and easy-to-prepare food that can be enjoyed by people of all ages and dietary preferences. It can be paired with a variety of vegetables, proteins, and sauces to create a delicious and satisfying meal.

Ingredients :

  • 400 grams spaghetti
  • 2 tbsp oil
  • 1 pc onion
  • 5 cloves garlic
  • ½ kg ground pork
  • 2 pcs Knorr Pork Broth Cubes
  • 2 tbsp tomato paste
  • 500 grams tomato sauce
  • ½ cup sugar
  • ½ tsp pepper
  • salt to taste

Instructions :

  • First, cook the spaghetti noodles according to package directions. Drain well and set aside. Leave some pasta water for later use.
  • Next, get a pan and make it nice and hot over medium heat. Pour some oil and throw in the onions and garlic. Cook until light brown. Then add the ground pork and cook until the color changes.
  • Add Knorr Pork Cubes, stir well to dissolve before adding the tomato paste and tomato sauce. Just sauté this for 2 minutes.
  • Now, add sugar, pepper and water and continue to simmer over medium-low heat for 15-20 minutes until sauce has slightly thickened. Give this a nice seasoning of salt. You can add more sugar if preferred. You can also use the remaining pasta water to add starch and body to the sauce.
  • Get a big platter ready for your cooked spaghetti noodles and pour the sauce on top with a sprinkle of grated cheese.
